bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ① Illness Sign of an inability to raise the four limbs, with the muscles and joints having no strength so that they are unable to support the body in standing or walking. Sheng ji zong lu 聖濟總錄 7: 其證四肢不舉，筋脈關節無力，不可枝梧者，謂之攤（癱） “If the signs are such that one cannot raise his four limbs, and if sinews and joints have no strength and cannot give support, then this is called ‘ paralysis ’”.

② Pathological Condition If a tan huan 癱瘓 , paralysis, affects the left side, the abbreviation is tan 癱 . Tai ping hui min he ji Recipe book. Northern Song, ju fang 1107~1110. 太平惠民和劑局方 1: 乳香應痛丸，治一切風氣，左癱右瘓，口眼喎斜，半身不遂， 語言謇澀 , “Pills with ru xiang that respond to pain cure all types of wind qi, left side paralysis , right side paralysis, with the mouth and eyes becoming slanted, and one half of the body not following one’s will. The [patient’s] language is impeded”.
